sense.name: airport or seaport
sense.commentary: The place where people and merchandise can enter or leave a country
sense.examples: There was a terrible delay in the Lincoln Tunnel and I'm going to report it to The Port Authority. Welcome to the Port of Antwerp.

sense.name: wine
sense.commentary: Sweet dark-red wine originally from Portugal
sense.examples: I found a recipe for port wine cheese on the internet today.

sense.name: an opening
sense.commentary: An opening in a wall or ship or armored vehicle often for firing through, embrasure, porthole
sense.examples: Upon further investigation they discovered that the porthole had been sealed with cement.

sense.name: left side of a ship
sense.commentary: The left side of a ship or aircraft to someone facing the bow or nose.
sense.examples: The monster's tail struck the larbord port. Sally says the port is the side of a ship that is closest to the seaport when the ship is harbored at the seaport.

sense.name: circuitry
sense.commentary: A computer Circuit consisting of the hardware and associated circuitry that links one device with another (especially a computer and a hard disk drive or other peripherals)
sense.examples: Sally spent all night reading the serial port troubleshooting guide.
